summary.span: 表示部门中的时间（如周、月和年）。

span.span: Represents time in divisions, such as weeks, months, and years.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 日历将时间划分为单位，如周、月和年。A calendar divides time into units, such as weeks, months, and years. 每个日历中的小数位数、长度和开始时间各不相同。The number, length, and start of the divisions vary in each calendar. > [!NOTE] > 有关在 .NET 中使用 calendar 类的信息，请参阅使用[日历](/dotnet/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars)。For information about using the calendar classes in .NET, see [Working with Calendars](/dotnet/standard/datetime/working-with-calendars). 任何时间点都可以使用特定日历表示为一组数值。Any moment in time can be represented as a set of numeric values using a particular calendar. 例如，阳历年3月 20 1999 日（1999，3，20，8，46，0，0.0）发生 vernal equinoxFor example, a vernal equinox occurred at (1999, 3, 20, 8, 46, 0, 0.0) in the Gregorian calendar, that is, March 20, 1999 C.E. 8：46：00：0.0。at 8:46:00:0.0. 的实现可以将特定日历范围内的任何日期映射到一组类似的数值， 可以使用 和 中的信息将此类数值集映射到文本表示形式。An implementation of can map any date in the range of a specific calendar to a similar set of numeric values, and can map such sets of numeric values to a textual representation using information from and . 文本表示形式可以是区分区域性的，例如，对于 en-us 区域性，为 "8:46 AM 3 月 20 1999 AD"，如 ISO 8601 格式为 "1999-03-20T08：46： 00"。The textual representation can be culture-sensitive, for example, "8:46 AM March 20th 1999 AD" for the en-US culture, or culture-insensitive, for example, "1999-03-20T08:46:00" in ISO 8601 format. 实现可以定义一个或多个纪元。A implementation can define one or more eras. 类将纪元标识为枚举整数，其中当前纪元（）的值为0。The class identifies the eras as enumerated integers, where the current era () has the value 0. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 若要解决日历年与地球围绕太阳旋转的实际时间或月球围绕地球旋转的实际时间之间的差异，闰年与标准日历年相差不同的天数。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每个 实现以不同的方式定义闰年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 为了保持一致性，每个间隔中的第一个单位（例如，第一个月）都分配了值1。For consistency, the first unit in each interval (the first month, for example) is assigned the value 1. 命名空间包括以下 实现：The namespace includes the following implementations: - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示 类的成员。The following code example demonstrates the members of the class. [!code-cpp[System.Globalization.Calendar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.Calendar/CPP/calendar.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Globalization.Calendar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.Calendar/CS/calendar.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Globalization.Calendar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Globalization.Calendar/VB/calendar.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `months` 值将添加到指定的 中。The `months` value is added to the specified . 如果 `months` 为负数，则生成的 早于指定的 。If `months` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 如果结果中的日不是生成的年份中的有效日期，则生成的 的日期部分会受到影响。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它将更改为生成的年份中的最后一个有效日。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 如果生成的月份超出指定的 的年份，则生成的 的年份部分会受到影响。The year part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is outside the year of the specified . 如果生成的年份超出指定的 的纪元，则生成的 的纪元部分会受到影响。The era part of the resulting is affected if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 生成的 的时间部分与指定的 保持相同。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 例如，假设当前日历有12个月，其中第四个月有30天，第十个月有31天。For example, suppose that the current calendar has 12 months, where the fourth month has 30 days and the tenth month has 31 days. 如果指定的月份是第十个月，指定的日期是该月的第31天，而 `months` 参数的值为6，则生成的年份比指定年份多一，生成的月份是第四个月，而结果日为第30天，即结果月份的最后一天。If the specified month is the tenth month, the specified day is the 31st day of that month, and the value of the `months` parameter is 6, the resulting year is one more than the specified year, the resulting month is the fourth month, and the resulting day is the 30th day, which is the last day of the resulting month. 如果 `months` 参数的值为负，则生成的 早于指定的 。If the value of the `months` parameter is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 返回的 值的 属性始终等于 。The property of the returned value always equals . 可以通过调用 方法来保留 `time` 参数的 属性，如下面的示例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks `years` 值将添加到指定的 中。The `years` value is added to the specified . 如果 `years` 为负数，则生成的 早于指定的 。If `years` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 如果结果中的日不是生成的年份中的有效日期，则生成的 的日期部分会受到影响。The day part of the resulting is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 它将更改为生成的年份中的最后一个有效日。It is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. 如果生成的月份不是结果年份中的有效月份，则生成的 的月份部分会受到影响。The month part of the resulting is affected if the resulting month is not a valid month in the resulting year. 它将更改为结果年份中的最后一个有效月份。It is changed to the last valid month in the resulting year. 如果生成的年份超出指定的 的纪元，则生成的 的纪元部分会受到影响。The era part of the resulting is affected if the resulting year is outside the era of the specified . 生成的 的时间部分与指定的 保持相同。The time-of-day part of the resulting remains the same as the specified . 例如，在公历中，2月有28天，但在闰年有29天的情况除外。For example, in the Gregorian calendar, February has 28 days, except during a leap year when it has 29 days. 如果指定的日期是闰年中2月29日的，而 `years` 的值为1，则生成的日期为下一年2月28日。If the specified date is the 29th day of February in a leap year and the value of `years` is 1, the resulting date is the 28th day of February in the following year. 如果 `years` 为负数，则生成的 早于指定的 。If `years` is negative, the resulting is earlier than the specified . 返回的 值的 属性始终等于 。The property of the returned value always equals . 可以通过调用 方法来保留 `time` 参数的 属性，如下面的示例所示。You can preserve the property of the `time` parameter by calling the method, as the following example shows. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在支持闰月的概念的日历中，闰月可以在特定月份之后或在一年中的任何月份之后发生。In a calendar that supports the notion of a leap month, the leap month can occur either after a particular month or after any month in a year. 例如， 方法返回1到13之间的一个数字，用于指示与指定日期关联的月份。For example, the method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. 如果该年的第八个月和第九个月之间有一个闰月，则 方法将为第八个月返回8，为第八个月返回9，在第9个月返回10个月。If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要解决日历年与地球围绕太阳旋转的实际时间或月球围绕地球旋转的实际时间之间的差异，闰年与标准日历年相差不同的天数。To make up for the difference between the calendar year and the actual time that the earth rotates around the sun or the actual time that the moon rotates around the earth, a leap year has a different number of days from a standard calendar year. 每个 实现以不同的方式定义闰年。Each implementation defines leap years differently. 闰日是指仅在闰年发生的日期。A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. 例如，在公历中，2月29日是唯一的闰日。For example, in the Gregorian calendar, the 29th day of February is the only leap day. ## Examples 下面的代码示例比较 类的不同实现。The following code example compares different implementations of the class. remarks.format: 此方法基于特定日历的当前纪元返回日期和时间。This method returns a date and time based on the current era of a particular calendar. 对于基于高层 reign 支持多个纪元的 和 ，调用此方法可能会在纪元发生更改时产生意外日期。For the and , which support multiple eras based on the reign of the emperor, calling this method can produce an unintended date when an era changes. 使用其中任一日历来实例化日期时，建议调用 或[system.xml.xmlconvert.todatetime （int32、int32、int32、int32、int32、int32、int32、int32）](xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32))方法并显式指定纪元。When instantiating a date using either of these calendars, we recommend that you call the or [JapaneseLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32,Int32)](xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.ToDateTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)) method and explicitly specify an era.

param.name: year
param.span: 一个两位数或四位数的整数，用于表示要转换的年份。

summary.span: 使用 属性将指定的年份转换为四位数年份，以确定相应的纪元。

span.span: Converts the specified year to a four-digit year by using the property to determine the appropriate century.

returns.span: 包含 的四位数表示形式的整数。

span.span: An integer that contains the four-digit representation of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为100年范围内可由两位数年份表示的最后一年。 is the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by a two-digit year. 通过在该100年范围内查找两位数 `year` 的唯一匹配项来确定纪元。The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit `year` within that 100-year range. 例如，如果 设置为2029，则100年范围是从1930到2029。For example, if is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，两位数值30被解释为1930，而两位数字的值29则解释为2029。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 如果 `year` 大于或等于100，则返回 `year` 的值不变。If `year` is greater than or equal to 100, the value of `year` is returned unchanged. 支持两位数年份或四位数年份。 supports either a two-digit year or a four-digit year. 如果传递了一个两位数的年份值（小于100），则会使方法根据表示相应世纪的 值将值转换为四位值。Passing a two-digit year value (less than 100) causes the method to convert the value to a four-digit value according to the value representing the appropriate century. 如果应用程序提供了一个四位数的年份值，该范围在支持的日历范围内以 ，则该方法将返回实际输入值。If the application supplies a four-digit year value that is within the supported calendar range to , the method returns the actual input value. 如果应用程序提供了一个在支持的日历范围之外的四位数值，或者如果它提供负值，则该方法将引发异常。If the application supplies a four-digit value that is outside the supported calendar range, or if it supplies a negative value, the method throws an exception.

exception.span: 超出了日历支持的范围。

span.span: is outside the range supported by the calendar.

summary.span: 获取或设置可以用两位数年份表示的 100 年范围内的最后一年。

span.span: Gets or sets the last year of a 100-year range that can be represented by a 2-digit year.

value.span: 可以用两位数年份表示的 100 年范围内的最后一年。

span.span: The last year of a 100-year range that can be represented by a 2-digit year.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性允许将两位数的年份正确翻译为四位数年份。This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. 例如，如果将此属性设置为2029，则100年范围是从1930到2029。For example, if this property is set to 2029, the 100-year range is from 1930 to 2029. 因此，两位数值30被解释为1930，而两位数字的值29则解释为2029。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1930, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 2029. 此属性的初始值派生自控制面板的 "区域和语言选项" 部分中的设置。The initial value of this property is derived from the settings in the regional and language options portion of Control Panel. 但是，在 的生命周期内，该信息可能会更改。However, that information can change during the life of the . 类不会自动检测系统设置中的更改。The class does not detect changes in the system settings automatically. 如果 "区域和语言" 选项中不支持日历，则此属性的初始值是 类定义的默认值。If the calendar is not supported in the regional and language options, the initial value of this property is the default value defined by the class. 您的应用程序应将此值设置为99，以指示要按字面取的两位数年份。Your application should set this value to 99 to indicate that 2-digit years are to be taken literally. 例如，如果将此属性设置为99，则100年的范围是从0（对于大多数日历而言不是有效的值）到99。For example, if this property is set to 99, the 100-year range is from 0 (not a valid value for most calendars) to 99. 因此，两位数值30被解释为30。Therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 30.
